1.Text: So summer vacation's almost over...

...Well, I did spend most of it getting pampered to
death.

Gotta say though, desert island life was a blast.
Nothin' wrong with a little adventure, especially on
summer break.

Oh, that reminds me, Alpha gave me an invitation from
Gamma. What's it sayâ€”

("Preparations for the event I mentioned previously
are complete. Thus, I request your attendance this
evening." Okay.)

(Actually, I don't know too much about events in this
world. But if they are going to the trouble to invite me
like this, I bet it'll be fun.)

(What if it's some crazy hero-selection ceremony where
people draw a sword stuck in a stone?!)
(Yeah! That'd be rad! As classic as it comes!)

(Heh... The birth of a future hero is something I'm
definitely not gonna miss out on!)

(A night market with lines of stalls, a big tower
standing in the middle of the space, paper lanterns
hanging everywhere...)

(This is a summer festival...! A place for lantern
festival dances! What happened to crowning a new
hero?!)

N-Now that think about it, maybe I did talk about
lantern dances a bit...

(Still, how on earth did they get the folksy feel of
a summer festival down so perfectly...)
...My good sir?
Hm?

Ah, I had a feeling it was you. To think I would find
you here.
Wait, I know you... You're the Blood Quâ€”

Please, do not speak that name. It's ill-suited to
such a delightful evening as this.

For today, I am simply Elisabeth, a harmless citizen
enjoying a pleasurable outing.
Ah, I get it. So you're going incognito.
Are you not as well?
Guess you got me there.

Still, I admit I am surprised. The festivals of this
age are so different. Another reminder of how much
time has passed while I slept.

Why look, good sir. Those lanterns are made of paper.
The way the light wavers is very pretty.

You would never find cultural refinement and lively
crowds like this 1,000 years ago.
Hahaha...
So, well...what do you think?
Huh? Oh, yeah, it's really lively.
I did not mean the festival. Oh, you are so cruel.
Cruel...? How so?

How can you see a woman all dressed up and say
nothing?

Oh, you mean that yukata? Where in the world did you
find one?

I popped by Mitsugoshi on the way here. They truly
stock the most wonderful things. I quite enjoyed my
time there.

This attire is very uncommon, no? I simply had to
have it, and even asked if I might wear it on the
spot... So, what do you think...?
You look nice.

Heehee, thank you, my good sir. A compliment from a
gentleman while dressed for a special occasion is all
the more welcome, don't you think?
Then...how about me?
Oh yeah, real nice.
...Wait, what? Who said that...?
It wasn't me.
How unkind... You didn't even look.
N-No way...
Good evening, Mister.

2.Text: Violet...?!
Oh, I recognize you from before...
Long time no see.

(...Huh? Do these two know each other? Never would've
expected that.)
So, why are you here, Violet?

I don't quite know myself... Perhaps this event has
something to do with it.

It's as if these odd sounds and lights beckoned me.
And then I was here, and I found you two.
Oh...

(Wait, doesn't Obon have something to do with
ancestors coming back to visit?)
(Maybe that's why Violet was drawn here, too.)

(Aw man, they didn't have to copy that part, too!
Guessing they probably didn't mean to, though!)
Do you have any idea as to why, good sir?
Nope, not at all. No way I'd know anything.
Hehe, well, I'll take your word for it.

At any rate, I'm here. But I'm afraid my little
trip astray is temporary... I can't stay here
forever.
You have to go back right away?

Well, I don't know. Personally, I'd like to have a
little fun first, since I'm here and all.

(She sure doesn't seem too concerned... Not that it
has anything to do with me, though.)
Okay, well, enjoy the summer festival.

My, what a cold thing to say. I'd say it's fate that
we met here. What's the harm in having a look around
together?
Huh...?

Now wait just a moment. You say it's fate that you
met here. Well, I believe that it's fate that I
encountered him as well.

Being unfamiliar with modern customs as I am...I was
hoping you would show me around, my dear sir. Please,
won't you honor me with your company?

Uhhh... Personally, I think we should all go our
separate ways. We'd stick out like a sore thumb as a
group...

You have a point... But I think more good would come
of us being together.
I dunno about that...

You don't see it? There are many souls of the
departed gathering in the area. I'm sure they were
drawn here like me.

I don't think anyone has noticed yet...but if these
souls remain here, I can imagine it might lead to
trouble.

So what you're saying is...they could turn into
evil spirits or something?

Yes, that's highly likely. If all the souls that have
wandered were to turn malevolent and lash out...I'm
certain the damage would be grievous.
There's that many of them?

They're everywhere. There, you see? That man over
there is one...

(He looks pretty normal at a glance... But I do kinda
pick up something weird about his magic. Maybe he's a
dead soul.)

It's as you say. I can tell that the gentleman over
there is not a normal person as well.

The souls don't seem harmful for the moment... But if
they continue to gather unabated, they will
eventually change for the worse.

Correct. The living and dead can't intermingle. For
the attachments of the dead are toxic to the living.

Besides, all they did was get lost. It's so sad to
see them tormented by their lingering regrets toward
life simply because of that.

So I was thinking it might be best to speak with them
so that they can return to where they belong. And
enjoy the festival while we do, naturally.
Got it. I understand the situation now.

...But it's that last part that you really care
about, right?

No, that's not true. But doesn't it make more sense
to enjoy ourselves if we're going to be doing the
same thing anyway?

(I understand the situation...but not gonna lie,
it doesn't seem like there's much in it for me.)

I will assist you. This is festival is so wonderful,
after all. Enjoying it to the end together sounds
like a fine idea.

(They could probably handle any fighting on their
own, too...)
(...Hold on a sec.)

(A festival is underway, peaceful and without
incident...except behind it all unfolds a epic battle
against ghosts! That totally sounds like a
shadowbroker scenario!)

(I can even look on from my hidden vantage point at
all those happy families talking about how fun this
all is! Hell yeah...!)
Okay, okay, I'll help, too.
Hehe, I had a feeling you'd say that.
Marvelous, good sir. You are so kind.
Alright, now let's go see the festival.
(Let the secret ghost-busting mission begin!)

3.Text: So...where do we start?

Hmm, let's see... I'll let you two decide. Is there
anything in particular you'd like to see?

It's all so new to me that I can't choose. All of the
stands look so delightful and charming.

Yes, it's true. If time allows, I'd love to see
everything...

In that case, how about we split up and you each go
check out whatever interests you? Then you can swap
info later. How about that?

What a great idea! We should be able to cover much
more ground in groups of two.

Yes, I agree. It's the best, most efficient option.
Now, why don't you start by accompanying her first?

Dear me, are you certain? Wouldn't you prefer to have
a gentlemanly escort as you take in the sights?

Of course I would. But all things require a guiding
hand in the beginning, and I don't like the idea of
leaving you on your own.

True. Elisabeth here is kind of a lost lamb when it
comes to the modern world.
Thank you both for your concern.
Hehe, you're welcome. Well, catch you later.
How about we get moving, too?
Yes, let's. Might I ask for your company, good sir?
Sure, that's why I'm here. So where to first?

I'm curious about the foods being sold in the night
market. I confess that I'm a light eater, but I was
hoping to sample as many things as possible...

Alright, then we'll start with something that isn't
too heavy.
What is this...?

A shaved ice stand. I thought it'd be good since it
won't fill you up much and is also a summer festival
standby.

Is this...nothing more than sweet syrup poured over
ice? I fail to see what could be so remarkable about
that...

Don't overthink it. You'll understand once you have
a bite.
Well, if you insist... I shall give it a try.
Oh my goodness...!
This...this is a delicacy!
See?

The texture of the shaved ice is like fluffy powdered
snow... And this strawberry syrupâ€”a tart tincture
that melts in the mouth alongside the ice... 
Absolutely wonderful.

I'm sorry that I ever looked down on it as mere ice
shavings doused in syrup.

I love how soft and easy it is to eat, with the
pleasant surprise that it is not overly filling at
all. The people of this era have created a true
frozen marvel.

Heheheh, don't get too surprised just yet. Wait until
you try cotton candy.

Cotton...candy? Given the name, I'm guessing it must
be sweet?
Here, try some.

My, it's as fluffy as a cloud! I wonder what it will
taste like...

...Oh, it melts inside the mouth right away! It's
like trying to bite into mist, and yet so sweet it
makes my tongue tingle... Heehee, splendid, like
something out of a dream.
Sounds like you're a fan.

Yes, to say the least. Unlike ice, this cotton candy
will not melt with time, so I can likely even take
some back as a souvenir for Mary.

(A souvenir, huh... The thing is, cotton candy sucks
in warm air and hardens really fast...)

(Nah, I'll spare her the cruel truth. Those little
next-day letdowns are part of the summer festival
experience, too.)

Say, my good sir. That stall over there says
"sculpted candy." Do you mind if we have a look?
Not at all.
Hm...? That man standing over there...
Excuse me.
What is it?

It's not a good idea for you to stay here. Don't you
think you should head home?

...Oh, so you mean that little feeling I had was
right? I thought that might be the case. Well, I've
had my fun, so guess I'll be heading back.

(He left way easier than I expected... Kinda feel bad
about interrupting his fun, but it is what it is.)
(Now where's Elisabeth...)

Wow, so you make it to order on the spot? In that
case...can you make me a bat?

(She's totally engrossed in the candy-making... Which
means maybe I can go check up on Violet.)

Oh, drat, I missed again... But even when I hit, the
targets never fall! This is so difficult...
Do I have to use a gun to play this game?

That's what we call doing whatever it takes to win
and then getting so caught up in the doing that you
forget about the winning... But yeah, this is a target
range, so you have to use a gun.

Oh...how long have you been watching? You mean imp.
You could've said something earlier.

Well, I didn't want to break your concentration.
But, hey, can I give you little advice?
Yes, please do.

It's easier to keep your aim steady if you hold the
gun with both hands. Use just one and it tends to
drift.

Also, the big prizes don't tip over easy. So instead
of just trying to shoot it and knock it down, you
want to aim where you think will throw off its center
of gravity.

Trust the modern boy to even be an expert on target
shooting.

I wouldn't call myself an expert, it's just that I've
done this before.

Okay, then I'll take your advice...and aim with both
hands...

Wow, not bad. All three shots hit. Congrats on
nabbing the prize.
Hehe, oh, I'm not through yet.

Now you'll hit all five shots. Somebody sure is a
quick learner. I'm impressed.
Maybe it's because I had a good teacher.
So much flattery. What're you scheming?

The truth is, I've become aware of something very
distressing. I was hoping we might discuss it.
Something very distressing?

Well, you're aware of my current situation, yes?
It's not like I was able to bring anything with me.
O-Okay, and...?
So can I borrow the money for the target game?

(Wait, so without a single zeni on her, she was able
to play with just a promise to pay later? Violet
sure knows how to get her way...)

...Sure, I can loan you a little. But I do mean just
a little. And make sure to pay me back. I barely
squeak by on my allowance as it is.

Hehe, of course. And thank you. I know I can always
count on you.

4.Text: Hehe, that was a lot of fun. Where shall we go next?
Ah, so this is where you ran off to.

Oh, hey, Elisabeth. How was your tour of the food
stands? Find anything yummy?

After the sculpted candy, I sampled a dish called
"okonomiyaki," The aroma of the sauce was to die
for... It was everything I ever wanted.

Oh yeah, you're preaching to the choir. The sauce
they use in those flour dishes is awesome. Sometimes
I can hardly stop myself from eating more.

Hehe, it certainly sounds like you used your time to
the fullest. Would you care to join us at the next
stand?

Oh, is that an invitation? How delightful. Where were
you planning to visit next?

...Uh, hey, aren't you guys forgetting the real
mission here?
Are we not enjoying the festival?
Um, that's not what I mean.

Hehe, yes, yes, I know. Our goal here is to guide the
souls of the deceased... But there's something I
want to do first.

Something you want to do...? Other than checking out
the stalls?
I was hoping I might have another duel with Violet.

Dear me, now that is interesting. I would be honored
to grant your request.
Uh, how did we end up here...?

(As I recall...these two both have pretty wild
fighting styles.)

Hey, if you go at it here, it won't be a festival
anymore. And we'd probably end up with a lot more
dead folks, too.
Heehee, oh, don't be silly.
This is the perfect stage.

Now, how about we settle this with some goldfish
scooping?

What a marvelous idea. That stand did catch my eye
earlier.
...Well, I guess that'd be okay.

(But these two are definitely losing sight of the big
picture...)

Okay, let's go over the rules. The winner is whoever
catches the most fish with three paper scoops. No
interference allowed. Are we clear?
I have no objections.
Me neither.
Alright, then let the game...begin!

Now, my fishy friends clad in pretty gold...I beseech
you to aid me in my hour of need. If you would kindly
come this waâ€”AH!
Uh-oh, it ripped.

I suppose the trick is to snatch them up quickly,
before the scoop tears. Just keep my aim steady
and...oh.
Looks like yours ripped, too.

I know better than most that nothing is certain in
life...but these scoops are so thin, so weak, so
fickle. I must be careful with my remaining two...

Perhaps I was a touch too hasty. I'll get it right
next time...

(While they're so into it, maybe I'll go get in some
ghost-busting.)

Nice and quiet, so the fish don't notice... Oh no.
Another blunder.

What, no?! It tore right through the scoop and swam
away...
Having a spot of trouble, are we?
I could say the same for you.
...Say, Violet. I have a proposal.

What a coincidence. I was about to make a proposal to
you as well. I'm sure we must be on the same train of
thought.
Okay, that's that. I swept that area...
How's it going? Do we have a winner?

See for yourself. Neither of us caught a single fish.
...Which I suppose means we have a draw.

This does not make for a proper contest, but most
importantly we aren't enjoying the game.

Say, good sir. Won't you teach us the secret of how
to play?
Oh... Okay, I think I get the picture.

(Turns out they're both more easy-going than I
thought. But, whatever, looks like they're having a
good time.)
Alright, I can give you some pointers.
We're counting on you, professor.
...Can you drop the professor part?

Come, good sir. Stop being bashful and commence with
the lesson, if you would.
Okay, okay. Now, the first thing is toâ€”

5.Text:
Look at all of these fish! Eeheehee, and it's all
thanks to my gifted instructor.

The same goes for me. I think my favorite is this one
with the big tail fin.

This small fellow is very brave and cute as well,
don't you think? I need to come up with a name.

Glad you both had fun. So, can we consider this
"duel" over?

Why, I'm having such a good time that making things
into any sort of competition is beginning to seem
rather droll. What say you, Violet?

I agree. The duel was only ever meant to add a bit of
spice to the fun, after all.

In that case, it's time you started helping with
talking to the ghosts.
Oh, right, that was our main goal, wasn't it.
...Says the one who mentioned it in the first place.

Just joking. I'd never leave all the work to you. But
the festival in this world is just so fun that
honestly I'd rather just keep on enjoying it.

Goodness, yes, I understand completely. Modern
festivals offer so very much to see.
I do get where you're coming from, yeah.

Of course you do. And in that light, it makes it all
the more sad that we have to spoil the fun of the
deceased as well.

It was the energy of the festival that called them
here, after all. They haven't done any harm, so I
only wish there was a way we could all relish this
moment in time together...

Yes, I agree. It would be so nice to offer those of
the distant past a brief moment of comfort.
Elisabeth?

...Oh, I just had a passing thought. That it would
have been so nice to have festivals like this during
my reign.

If only I could have enjoyed such peaceful moments of
merrymaking with old friends and subjects, all of us
as equals... But this is nothing I haven't said
before.

Indeed. Sadly, that sight didn't become a reality in
our day.

But it did now, all this time later. That's not so
bad, is it?

You have the right of it, Violet. We must make sure
this festive night ends on an even higher note.

Dragging our feet to prolong the end won't make the
fun last forever, either. If they have somewhere to
return to, then return they must.
And what happens if they don't?

Their sense of self and purpose will gradually fade,
leaving them nothing more than wandering spirits.

Some will likely seek out the living from loneliness,
while others may be driven by envy to do harm.

All with no end, no sense of self... How pitiful to
become a being that only causes injury to others.

Indeed. All the more reason why we must urge them to
go back from where they came.
You guys...

(So they aren't just caught up in the festival.
They're really putting thought into this.)

(Well, they won't outdo me! I gotta make a shadow
operative move, protecting everyone by secretly
busting ghosts on the night of the busy festival!)

All right, playtime's over, you two. From here on, we
need to focus on sending the dead home in a way that
doesn't alert the normal folks around us.
Someone sure is motivated now.

So you have compassion even for the deceased. What a
gentle soul you are...

(...I think they're reading me wrong, but hey, at
least they seem enthused now.)

Now, are we working under any kind of time limit
here?

I...think it would be best to consider the end of the
festival our limit. After all, the festival is what
brought us here.

It would probably be safe to assume that the deceased
drawn here will only be in their right minds while the
festival is underway.

I can almost guarantee that once it's over, they'll
begin to lose their focus...

Okay...so how about we set the fireworks at the end
of the festival as our deadline?

Yes, that sounds reasonable. We can split up and
seek out the ghosts individually.

Now, let's get down to business. It's time to send
these spirits on their way.

6.Text:
Hello. It's a splendid night, isn't it? I hope you'll
pardon this sudden intrusion.

Dear me, what a darling young lady you are. What can
this old woman do for you?

I believe maybe you've noticed...but it's nearly time
to be returning home. I simply thought I would give
you a reminder, just in case.

My, I appreciate the kind effort. But, yes, I know I
must be leaving.

There is a part of me that wishes I could stay a
little while longer... But as they say, sometimes not
enough is just right.

Yes, I know the feeling. The gorgeous lights, the
sounds of people enjoying themselves... It's hard to
leave that behind, isn't it.

It is... But I don't want to worry anyone. Perhaps
it's time I was on my way.
I shall see you off, so that you make it back safely.

Thank you, young lady. I do so hope we see another
night like thisâ€”
Hey, what's the matter, boy?

I don't know how I got here... Where am I...?
Where's my mom...?

Oh, you poor thing. You're completely lost and have
no idea what's happening, do you.

But don't you worry. Just take a deep breath and look
around you. I'm sure you'll find the way home.

The way home... Hey, is that it over there, where the
light is?

Yes, that's right. You be careful on the way back,
okay? Don't go running and trip and fall.
Aren't you leaving, too? You aren't coming with me?
What?

Because you're just like me, right? So I thought
maybe you'd be going, too.

Hehe, oh, you're worried about me. Thanks, kiddo. But
I can't go with you. My home is a tiny bit closer to
where we are now, you see.

Oh... Well, I'm gonna go, then. Take care, lady!
Bye-bye!

Hey, the dead are really thinning out. Things are
moving at a pretty decent pace.

...Hey, there's one. Maybe she's the last of 'em.
I'll go chat her up.

Excuse me! You're one of the deceased, right? The
festival's almost over, so it'd be best if you left.

I'm...looking for someone... I can't leave until I
find him...!

Oh... But that doesn't really change anything. If you
don't leave before the end of the festival, something
bad couldâ€”

That has nothing to do with me! I want to see him!
I won't leave until I do!

Uh, but if you don't leave, you'll turn into an evil
spirit, so it actually does have something to do
with you...

So what if I become an evil spirit! Does that in some
way inconvenience you?!
Sh-She's really lost it...

(Maybe the best play here is find this guy she's
looking for. That seems like the quickest way to
resolve this.)
Okay, then let me help. What's this guy like?

He's slim and tall and kind...and a despicable slug
of a man who betrayed my trust and was unfaithful the
entire time.
(What the?! Something in the air feels different...)

I swear I will find him and have my revenge... He
will regret the day he trampled on my heart...
(Damn, that sounds like an evil spirit to me!)

About that revenge, do you know where this guy is
now?

I won't give up until I find him... This is my first
chance in the hundred years since I died... No, he
will not escape me...

Okay... Well, if it's been a hundred years, then
chances are this man's dead, too, no? I'm not sure
you'll find him...
I will if I don't stop until I do!

(Things are starting to move...! Is she a
poltergeist?!)

No one will get in my way...! I will find him, and I
will have my revenge!
Yep, she's definitely going bad!
Is everything all right, good sir?
Oh dear... It seems you've really made her angry.

Hey, she blew up all on her own... Anyway, what do
you think I should do?

At this point, we're going to have to force her to
stop. I doubt we'd be able to talk her down in this
state.

Angry spirit of the departed, be at peace... Exhaust
your fury in battle with us. I am certain that will
calm you.

7.Text:
The poltergeist stuff has chilled out, so maybe she's
vented some her anger, too.
Leave me alone! I...I must have my revenge!
Welp, never mind.
Seems like she still has more to let go of, hm?
Violet, may I ask for your assistance?
Yes, of course.

*sniff, sob*... Why...why are you stopping me...?
All I want to do is see him...

...I have some familiarity with how you feel. That
the time you had together was so wonderful makes the
betrayal all the more painful, more heart-breaking.

That's why you want help, why you want to see him,
is it not?

Those pleasant memories, and the suffering you feel
now, must be brought to an end.

Otherwise, you won't be able to move on. If you stay
here, you'll become something else, something doomed
to wander lost for eternity.

Your happy memories, your pain, your desiresâ€”all of
it will vanish. You will no longer be you.
That isn't a fate you want for yourself, is it?

...No. I...will leave. I can see my time here is
over.
...Take care on the way back.
I'm sorry for the trouble I caused. Farewell...
I pray that she, too, is able to rest peacefully.

Was she the last one? I think we might've seen them
all on their way.
...We sincerely apologize for the malfunction.

We have confirmed that everything is back in working
order and the festival can resume. The fireworks will
begin shortlyâ€”

I'm glad we finished in time. I was hoping we could
enjoy the closing fireworks show in peace.

Well, I have an idea to go get something to eat. That
was a lot of work, so I could use a little snack. Ah,
how nice. There was still so much I wanted to try.

Sorry for the imposition, but would you two mind
finding us a spot?
No problem. We'll go on ahead.
Hey, it's started!

How beautiful! They're like great flowers bursting
into bloom. The very meaning of the word magnificent.

Yes, that's so true. It's the perfect way to bring
the festival to a close.

All in all, this was a splendid evening. Everything I
sampled from the vendors was scrumptious, and you and
I had a most delightful duel.

I enjoyed the target range and candy carving, too.
If we get the chance, I'd love to try both with you.

Yes, I would love that as well! I'll hold you to that
promise, Violet.
I'm glad that you both had such a great time.

Once these fireworks end, that's pretty much it for
summer, too...

All things must come to an end, otherwise we can't
move forward, hm?
Didn't you just say that earlier?
Oh, maybe I did.
Heehee...
So, did you enjoy yourself tonight, good sir?
Hmm, well, I guess you could say it was productive.

But not "fun"? How very like you to choose such a
word.
What about you, Violetâ€”
...Huh? Violet?

This concludes the fireworks display. Thank you all
very much for coming this evening.

...It seems she had to return as well. Back to whence
she belongs.

It's time I make my way home as well. Mary will begin
to worry if I stay out too late. Thank you for the
delightfully thrilling night, my good sir.
...Man, what a weird night.

(First there was a Japanese festival, and then a
ghost-busting adventure...)

(Nothing wrong with lantern dances, but...the dead
folks wandering in is kind of a problem.)

(Better put in a word with Gamma so they do something
different next year.)
...Next year, huh.
Another summer comes to an end.
